25FDF7DE6E4D46088C44E766621B1657.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations,
activities and read alouds.

82458F31C601406DBB5711AA9D36BEE9.description:
Identify real-life connections between words
and their use (e.g., “Tell me the name of a place
in the classroom that is noisy or quiet.”).

B84632BC90C24484952368369794202E.description:
Begin to understand opposites of simple and
familiar words.

0407140EE7864481B98A421B1BA42034.description:
Begin to sort familiar objects (e.g., sort a
collection of plastic animals into groups: dogs,
tigers, and bears).

2CE6480ABA46427AB73D0F7AF7C8C02E.description: With guidance and support, explore word relationships.

443C09D65726453790F776370F8EA03A.description:
With guidance and support, generate words that
are similar in meaning (e.g., rock/stone, happy/glad).

0935B567E68A412E893255B40E3F5303.description:
Begin to determine the meaning of new words and
phrases introduced through preschool reading and
content.

E60F2F669D394870BEB727A43178C213.description:
Attempt to write a letter or letters by
using scribble-writing, letter-like forms,
letter-strings, and invented spelling
during writing activities throughout the
day.

32B38D6B4CA84AEEAA65CA7058301129.description:
Begin to understand the simple conventions of
standard English grammar during reading and
writing experiences throughout the day.

A856172F693148658D861DA422941082.description:
Understands and can follow simple
multi-step directions.

F29E643E76B1442DA9F6778260FA1D1D.description: Begin to speak in complete sentences.

FC387AECE14048FA81971C92DBAE8E67.description:
Use frequently occurring prepositions
(e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, by,
with).

409F0A1648E84C4AAAF224D7B5616A06.description:
Understand and use question words (e.g.,
who, what, where, when, why, how).

9A70031D06DA43B29BB34E129EEA65BE.description:
Use frequently occurring nouns and
verbs.

7186A44F42CC471998559E3AF782E072.description:
Begin to understand the conventions of standard
English grammar when speaking during
interactions and activities.

6FA55E46091F421BA7AE2394810A9156.description:
With guidance and support, speak audibly and express
thoughts, feelings, and ideas.

C50560E386DB4E43B9CAA9AD22930546.description:
Use drawings or visual displays to add to descriptions to
provide additional detail.

45E17DC5E09C400D9A833D287F1181FB.description:
Begin to describe familiar people, places, things, and events
and sometimes with detail.

07C912475D4A461C888828E1C830718C.description:
Ask and answer questions to seek help, get information, or
follow directions.

73282CCE11DE4A579B79A4E7E1862399.description:
Ask and answer questions about a text or other information
read aloud or presented orally.

5B9BB75B9BA54D079375BBD2378E3415.description:
Continue a conversation through several back and
forth exchanges.

92BE40B787FB470289C0D03E260EEDBC.description:
Follow-agreed upon rules for discussions during
group interactions.

61BDE3CA55DA4C119B97CBE7BE49298C.description:
Participate in conversations and interactions with peers and
adults individually and in small and large groups.

96206D6A70AD4F14A9ADD01570C858D8.description:
With guidance and support, recall information from experience or
familiar topic to answer a question.

54260716157C4B3EAF519813C8F087A6.description:
With guidance and support, participate in shared research and shared
writing projects.

74E509D2739D48788B3F470AA188F1D9.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

BC20C46C48754D86BAC6A4DB6A4D82D2.description:
With guidance and support, use digital tools to express
ideas (e.g., taking a picture of a block structure to
document or express ideas, etc.).

2B6279D84C7346DEA6BC6D51ED6F68D5.description:
With guidance and support, share a drawing with
dictation, scribble-writing, letter-strings, or invented
spelling to describe an event real or imagined.

95F1A0A1EC924B439DB19D0D9BE93B19.description:
Use a combination of drawings, dictation, scribble writing,
letter-strings, or invented spelling to share information
during play or other activities.

5FD4AF18248C48FC93565DECA63C379C.description:
Use a combination of drawings, dictation, scribble writing,
letter-strings, or invented spelling to share a preference or
opinion during play or other activities.

813CCA1EFADE4DC6ADBC88BAD2820E63.description:
Begin to engage in a variety of texts with purpose and
understanding.

7F4F3F8BBE3E4251B5FFA7A2DF6197E0.description:
Recognize their name in print as well as other
 familiar print in the environment.

894F24E3F8B64F4F877C3DC6A65287CC.description:
Associates many letters (consonants and
 vowels as ready) with their names and
 their most frequent sounds.

8E1F91C82E2846FB9D7CB3F5CEE348AB.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of beginning phonics and
word skills.

5FA41F7A468242D69CEA13201F6E191D.description: Identify many initial sounds of familiar words.

2184CFCFF7E84CE88A389DD5FDE536C6.description:
Segment syllables in spoken words by
clapping out the number of syllables.

B6F1796967744102A7C560228C22A672.description:
Recognize and produce simple rhyming
words.

D310FE3DF3BC4068A0958710465CB1E3.description:
Demonstrate understanding of spoken words and begin
to understand syllables and sounds (phonemes).

511A882529244B5192D2959D9628263F.description:
Recognize and name many upper and lower case
letters of the alphabet.

4F02D483255E4C0C9A2A8B48BE0204B7.description: Recognize that words are separated by spaces.

238DA4ADEEBB43A4984664C3E5ED0327.description:
Recognize that spoken words can be written and
read.

FAC76DD2F3AD480FAB22F1233AC0AC15.description:
Follow words from left to right, top to bottom,
page by page.

6FFAF6D5EB2E42CCAB5217FFB1B444A9.description:
Begin to demonstrate understanding of basic features of
print.

ED553D447EBF4B878940D3091E95C9E0.description:
Actively participate in read aloud experiences using age
appropriate information books individually and in small
and large groups.

993CA23A8CE9494981F8D2D3D3A75992.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

BB9A838A981041B391B7460EFA54F02D.description:
With prompting and support, tell how the illustrations
support the text (information or topic) in informational text.

7F22B58AD03041999C8C35902D739CD8.description:
With prompting and support, identify the role of author and
illustrator in presenting ideas in informational text.

CF326D31C6C541AB9E92D8C009CCB471.description: Identify the front and back cover of a book.

EDDFA776648745D7870D589D41C49384.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about
unfamiliar words in informational text.

7FD4C37ACCDF45E1B497C90FF1463A3E.description:
With prompting and support, make a connection between
pieces of essential information in a familiar text.

040AA10E31944AE4801042BE1C0788B8.description:
With prompting and support, recall important facts from a
familiar text.

571C59E690E24AB8B848EC6130DDC293.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about
key elements in a familiar text.

53E1926087524FA187679FD9970275D3.description:
Actively participate in read aloud experiences using age
appropriate literature in individual, small and large
groups.

D62353DB42484D1C93F140B94064F054.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

829B55D5684B473B93A2906022826B14.description:
With prompting and support using a familiar storybook,
tell how adventures and experiences of characters are alike
and how they are different.

89CE9EE6D7E44810B8080D6432491817.description:
With prompting and support, using a familiar storybook,
tell how the illustrations support the story.

549778BD5FD34E1599D7EE6BB3813747.description:
With prompting and support, identify the role of author and
illustrator in telling the story.

A1D80E25E0C94B7F92917C59DCD0D257.description:
Recognize common types of literature (storybooks and
poetry books).

6195BB6DB3A84B029F87C18F79567D93.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about
unfamiliar words in a story or poem read aloud.

23580528BA4A4ED683594B388507879B.description:
With prompting and support, identify characters, settings,
and major events in a familiar story.

4DEF06BD18D84A7AAED8063030EE3D6B.description:
With prompting and support, retell familiar stories or
poems.

2505EAE274F84B8CA08A51052B160B7D.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer key elements in a
familiar story or poem.
